sense.name: exist in a long configuration
sense.commentary: Syntax includes: NP1[patient] STRETCH PP[directional] NP1[patient] STRETCH PP[locational] Includes: STRETCH ALONG
sense.examples: The park stretched beneath the train line. A huge cloud of dense smoke stretched across the horizon. The Andes stretch for 7250 km along the west coast of South America. The refugee camps stretch as far as the eye can see.

sense.name: lengthen, widen, or extend, esp. by pulling
sense.commentary: Note: Metaphorical Use: Increase capacity Includes: STRETCH FORTH, STRETCH OUT
sense.examples: The cat woke up, yawned, and stretched. Stretch out your legs if you have to sit for long periods. She stretched forth her hand and helped him from his chair. That elastic band will snap if you stretch it too far. The polyester fabric stretches in both directions to hold wraps securely in place. Dear God, please do help me to stretch my patience. National law is a great incentive for a plaintiff or a defendant to try and stretch the rules in his favour. White grapes were required in the blend, which were used to stretch the wine. The sleeves of this sweater have stretched. Many families' budgets are already stretched to breaking point.

sense.name: lie down comfortably
sense.examples: The cat stretched by the fire. To enjoy the picnic, we stretched out on the grass. I can picture it. Your greyhound stretched out on the couch with no room for you.
